org.flixel
Class FlxSprite

java.lang.Object
  org.flixel.FlxPoint
      org.flixel.FlxRect
          org.flixel.FlxObject
              org.flixel.FlxSprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlxFade, FlxFlash, FlxParticle, FlxText, FlxTileblock
public class FlxSprite
extends FlxObject

The main "game object" class, handles basic physics and animation.

Field Detail

LEFT

public static final int LEFT
Useful for controlling flipped animations and checking player orientation.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constant Field Values

DOWN

public static final int DOWN
Useful for checking player orientation.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

offset

public FlxPoint offset
If you changed the size of your sprite object to shrink the bounding box, you might need to offset the new bounding box from the top-left corner of the sprite.

scale

public FlxPoint scale
Change the size of your sprite's graphic. NOTE: Scale doesn't currently affect collisions automatically, you will need to adjust the width, height and offset manually. WARNING: scaling sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x!

blend

public java.lang.String blend
Blending modes, just like Photoshop! E.g. "multiply", "screen", etc.

antialiasing

public boolean antialiasing
Controls whether the object is smoothed when rotated, affects performance.

finished

public boolean finished
Whether the current animation has finished its first (or only) loop.

frameWidth

public int frameWidth
The width of the actual graphic or image being displayed (not necessarily the game object/bounding box). NOTE: Edit at your own risk!! This is intended to be read-only.

frameHeight

public int frameHeight
The height of the actual graphic or image being displayed (not necessarily the game object/bounding box). NOTE: Edit at your own risk!! This is intended to be read-only.

frames

public int frames
The total number of frames in this image (assumes each row is full).

scaleAndRotateFromCentre

public boolean scaleAndRotateFromCentre
Constructor Detail

FlxSprite

public FlxSprite(float X,
                 float Y,
                 java.lang.Integer SimpleGraphic)
Creates a white 8x8 square FlxSprite at the specified position. Optionally can load a simple, one-frame graphic instead.

Parameters:
X - The initial X position of the sprite.
Y - The initial Y position of the sprite.
SimpleGraphic - The graphic you want to display (OPTIONAL - for simple stuff only, do NOT use for animated images!).

FlxSprite

public FlxSprite(float X,
                 float Y)
Creates a white 8x8 square FlxSprite at the specified position. Optionally can load a simple, one-frame graphic instead.

Parameters:
X - The initial X position of the sprite.
Y - The initial Y position of the sprite.

Method Detail

loadGraphic

public FlxSprite loadGraphic(int Graphic,
                             boolean Animated,
                             boolean Reverse,
                             int Width,
                             int Height,
                             boolean Unique)
Load an image from an embedded graphic file.

Parameters:
Graphic - The image you want to use.
Animated - Whether the Graphic parameter is a single sprite or a row of sprites.
Reverse - Whether you need this class to generate horizontally flipped versions of the animation frames.
Width - OPTIONAL - Specify the width of your sprite (helps FlxSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Height - OPTIONAL - Specify the height of your sprite (helps FlxSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Unique - Whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

loadRotatedGraphic

public FlxSprite loadRotatedGraphic(int Graphic,
                                    int Rotations,
                                    int Frame,
                                    boolean AntiAliasing,
                                    boolean AutoBuffer)
Create a pre-rotated sprite sheet from a simple sprite. This can make a huge difference in graphical performance!

Parameters:
Graphic - The image you want to rotate & stamp.
Frames - The number of frames you want to use (more == smoother rotations).
Offset - Use this to select a specific frame to draw from the graphic.
AntiAliasing - Whether to use high quality rotations when creating the graphic.
AutoBuffer - Whether to automatically increase the image size to accomodate rotated corners.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

                                    int Rotations,
                                    int Frame,
                                    boolean AntiAliasing)

Parameters:
Graphic - The image you want to rotate & stamp.
Frames - The number of frames you want to use (more == smoother rotations).
Offset - Use this to select a specific frame to draw from the graphic.
AntiAliasing - Whether to use high quality rotations when creating the graphic.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

createGraphic

public FlxSprite createGraphic(int Width,
                               int Height,
                               int Color,
                               boolean Unique,
                               java.lang.String Key)
This function creates a flat colored square image dynamically.

Parameters:
Width - The width of the sprite you want to generate.
Height - The height of the sprite you want to generate.
Color - Specifies the color of the generated block.
Unique - Whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache.
Key - Optional parameter - specify a string key to identify this graphic in the cache. Trumps Unique flag.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

getFacing

public int getFacing()
Set facing using FlxSprite.LEFT,RIGHT, UP, and DOWN to take advantage of flipped sprites and/or just track player orientation more easily.

setFacing

public void setFacing(int Direction)

getAlpha

public float getAlpha()

setAlpha

public void setAlpha(float Alpha)
Set alpha to a number between 0 and 1 to change the opacity of the sprite.

getColor

public int getColor()

setColor

public void setColor(int Color)
Set color to a number in this format: 0xRRGGBB. color IGNORES ALPHA. To change the opacity use alpha. Tints the whole sprite to be this color (similar to OpenGL vertex colors).

draw

public void draw(FlxSprite Brush,
                 int X,
                 int Y)
This function draws or stamps one FlxSprite onto another. This function is NOT intended to replace render()!

Parameters:
Brush - The image you want to use as a brush or stamp or pen or whatever.
X - The X coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.
Y - They Y coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.

draw

                 int X)

Parameters:
Brush - The image you want to use as a brush or stamp or pen or whatever.
X - The X coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.

drawLine

public void drawLine(float StartX,
                     float StartY,
                     float EndX,
                     float EndY,
                     int Color,
                     int Thickness)
This function draws a line on this sprite from position X1,Y1 to position X2,Y2 with the specified color.

Parameters:
StartX - X coordinate of the line's start point.
StartY - Y coordinate of the line's start point.
EndX - X coordinate of the line's end point.
EndY - Y coordinate of the line's end point.
Color - The line's color.
Thickness - How thick the line is in pixels (default value is 1).

fill

public void fill(int Color)
Fills this sprite's graphic with a specific color.

Parameters:
Color - The color with which to fill the graphic, format 0xAARRGGBB.

update

public void update()
Main game loop update function. Override this to create your own sprite logic! Just don't forget to call super.update() or any of the helper functions.

Overrides:
update in class FlxObject

render

public void render()
Called by game loop, updates then blits or renders current frame of animation to the screen

Overrides:
render in class FlxObject

addAnimation

public void addAnimation(java.lang.String Name,
                         int[] Frames,
                         float FrameRate,
                         boolean Looped)
Adds a new animation to the sprite.

Parameters:
Name - What this animation should be called (e.g. "run").
Frames - An array of numbers indicating what frames to play in what order (e.g. 1, 2, 3).
FrameRate - The speed in frames per second that the animation should play at (e.g. 40 fps).
Looped - Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.

                         int[] Frames,
                         float FrameRate)

Frames - An array of numbers indicating what frames to play in what order (e.g. 1, 2, 3).
FrameRate - The speed in frames per second that the animation should play at (e.g. 40 fps).

Parameters:

Frames - An array of numbers indicating what frames to play in what order (e.g. 1, 2, 3).

addAnimationCallback

public void addAnimationCallback(FlxAnimationListener AnimationCallback)
Pass in a function to be called whenever this sprite's animation changes.

Parameters:
AnimationCallback - A function that has 3 parameters: a string name, a uint frame number, and a uint frame index.

play

public void play(java.lang.String AnimName,
                 boolean Force,
                 int StartFrame)
Modified by Hectate Plays an existing animation (e.g. "run"). If you call an animation that is already playing it will be ignored. If the requested starting frame is greater than the available frames, it will revert to frame 0.

Parameters:
AnimName - The string name of the animation you want to play.
Force - Whether to force the animation to restart.
StartFrame - Which frame of the animation to start from if possible.

play

public void play(java.lang.String AnimName,
                 boolean Force)
Plays an existing animation (e.g. "run"). If you call an animation that is already playing it will be ignored. If the requested starting frame is greater than the available frames, it will revert to frame 0.

Parameters:
AnimName - The string name of the animation you want to play.
Force - Whether to force the animation to restart.

play

public void play(java.lang.String AnimName)
Plays an existing animation (e.g. "run"). If you call an animation that is already playing it will be ignored. If the requested starting frame is greater than the available frames, it will revert to frame 0.

Parameters:
AnimName - The string name of the animation you want to play.

Call this function to figure out the on-screen position of the object.

Overrides:
getScreenXY in class FlxObject
Parameters:
P - Takes a Point object and assigns the post-scrolled X and Y values of this object to it.
Returns:
The Point you passed in, or a new Point if you didn't pass one, containing the screen X and Y position of this object.

getScreenXY

public FlxPoint getScreenXY()
Call this function to figure out the on-screen position of the object.

Returns:
The Point you passed in, or a new Point if you didn't pass one, containing the screen X and Y position of this object.

splitSprite

public java.util.ArrayList<FlxSprite> splitSprite(FlxSprite obj,
                                                  int Width,
                                                  int Height)
By Rolpege Call this to split up a sprite into little sprites.

Parameters:
Sprite - The sprite you want to split.
Width - The width of the splitted sprites.
Height - The height of the splitted sprites.
Returns:
An Array full of the splitted sprites
